note.note-paragraph: As far as possible, classification is made according to constructional features; classification according to particular kinds of aircraft is normally regarded as being of secondary importance, except in cases where this is considered to be the characteristic feature.
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups: - B64C35/02 covered by B64C35/00

title-part.text: Constructional features common to fuselages, wings, stabilising surfaces and the like

reference.text: aerodynamical features common to fuselages, wings, stabilising surfaces, and the like B64C23/00 ; flight-deck installations B64D

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted to absorb crash loads
Folding or collapsing to reduce overall dimensions, e.g. foldable tail booms
comprising means for preventing icing or condensation conditions

note.note-paragraph: Documents classified in B64C11/001 - B64C11/008 which also contain relevant information, covered by other subgroups of B64C11/00 , are also classified in the appropriate subgroup of B64C11/00

Propulsive discs, i.e. discs having the surface specially adapted for propulsion purposes

including rotating masses or servo rotors

title-part.text: Airplanes, i.e. having wings and tail planes
Ornithopters, i.e. generating lift and propulsion by flapping wings or insect like means
characterised by type of power plant
Electric power sources therefor, e.g. fuel cells, solar panels or batteries
by internal combustion engines, e.g. oscillating piston or rotary piston engines
by rocket engines, ramjets, or pulse-reactors
characterised by in-flight supply of energy
by recharging of batteries, e.g. by induction
by taking-off horizontally by own power, e.g. from a runway

reference.text: for helicopters B64C2201/024 ; for balloons B64C2201/022

title-part.text: characterised by the lift producing means
Lifting aerostatically, e.g. using lighter-than-air gases in chambers
Deployable wings, e.g. foldable or morphing wings
as communication relays, e.g. high altitude platforms
adapted for performing different kinds of missions, e.g. multipurpose use
for photography, or video recording, e.g. by using cameras
for transporting goods other than bombs
autonomous, i.e. by navigating independently from ground or air stations, e.g. by using inertial navigation systems (INS)
using satellite radio beacon positioning systems, e.g. GPS
using tethers for connecting to ground station
characterised by type of propulsion unit
using rockets, ramjets, pulse jets, plasma, or the like
by being caught in mid-air, or next to the ground, e.g. using a net
by deploying parachutes, or the like
by landing horizontally, e.g. on a runway
Methods for transport, or storage of unmanned aerial vehicles
in rucksacks, or bags to be carried by persons
by waterborne vehicles, e.g. ships or submarines or by hovercraft
by airborne vehicles, e.g. airplanes or helicopters
by landborne vehicles, e.g. trucks, lorries, tanks or cars
Flying model aircraft, flying toy aircraft
Modular constructions of airplanes or helicopters
by using acoustic waves generated by transducers
by explicitly adjusting fluid flow, e.g. by using valves, variable aperture or slot areas, variable pump action or variable fluid pressure
by influencing fluid flow by means of surface cavities, i.e. net fluid flow is null
by influencing fluid flow by heating using other means than combustion
by using electromagnetic tiles, fluid ionizers, static charges or plasma
by blowing other fluids over the surface than air, e.g. He, H, O2 or exhaust gases
by using small jets that make the fluid flow oscillate
by passively inducing fluid flow, e.g. by means of a pressure difference between both ends of a slot or duct
by using a surface having multiple apertures of relatively small openings other than slots
by using passive resonance cavities, e.g. without transducers
by using rib lets or hydrophobic surfaces

Codes corresponding to the former IdT classification of class 62

Protection means, e.g. against rust, water, fire
with movable weight not acting as pendulum
with parts of the aircraft acting as pendulum
by other pulse power source, e.g. aerodynamical effect, propellers
by auxiliary fixed or movable surfaces or other special devices, or surfaces acting as parachutes
with movable weight not acting as pendulum

Special devices to stabilise or to compensate a gyroplane pivoting torque

Pressure equalising devices between the inside of the wing and the atmosphere
Wings or parts thereof movable during flight
by auxiliary surfaces at the wings tips
by auxiliary surfaces outside the wings tips

by other means, e.g. propellers, rotors, air jets
